Journal.Title: Environmental science and pollution research international

Article.ArticleTitle: Catalytic ozonation of phenol by ZnFe<sub>2</sub>O<sub>4</sub>/ZnNCN: performance and mechanism.

AbstractText: A novel magnetic catalyst was synthesized and applied in heterogeneous catalytic ozonation process. The ZnFe<sub>2</sub>O<sub>4</sub>/ZnNCN material was synthesized by hydrothermal and high-temperature calcination method and characterized by XPS, XRD, FTIR, VSM, and SEM techniques. In the system of O<sub>3</sub>/ZnFe<sub>2</sub>O<sub>4</sub>/ZnNCN, the removal rates of phenol and chemical oxygen demand (COD) reached 93% and 43% at 60 min. Further analysis shows that ZnFe<sub>2</sub>O<sub>4</sub>/ZnNCN has a significant catalytic effect on O<sub>3</sub>, which is demonstrated by the first-order kinetic constant being 1.93 times than O<sub>3</sub> alone. The catalyst exhibits excellent cycling stability during repeated catalytic ozonation process and can be fully recycled under an applied magnetic field. The role of hydrogen peroxide (H<sub>2</sub>O<sub>2</sub>) and surface hydroxyl groups was investigated, and a mechanism for catalytic ozonation was proposed. This work not only builds an efficient catalytic ozonation system, but also provides a potential modification strategy for spinel oxides.
